description: ERECTION OF REAR ROOF DORMER ROOF EXTENSION, 1X ROOF LIGHT IN THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE, SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION, REMOVAL OF EXISTING GABLE PORCH, REPLACEMENT WINDOW ON GROUND FLOOR FRONT ELEVATION. decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 
202102-101A, 202102-102A and 202102-103A received on 9 March 2023

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - Removal of PD (Windows/Doors) - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in side elevation (facing 17 Seaforth Avenue) without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision
   ii) The application was approved without delay.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Any works/events carried out either by, or at the behest of, the developer, whether they are located on, or affecting a prospectively maintainable highway, as defined under Section 87 of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991, or on or affecting the public highway, shall be co-ordinated under the requirements of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991 and the Traffic management Act 2004 and licensed accordingly in order to secure the expeditious movement of traffic by minimising disruption to users of the highway network in Merton. Any such works or events commissioned by the developer and particularly those involving the connection of any utility to the site, shall be co-ordinated by them in liaison with the London Borough of Merton, Network Coordinator, (telephone 020 8545 3976). This must take place at least one month in advance of the works and particularly to ensure that statutory undertaker connections/supplies to the site are co-ordinated to take place wherever possible at the same time.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
Under the Clean Air Act 1993 the whole of the borough is designated as a smoke control area. It is an offence to emit smoke from a chimney of a building unless using an exempt appliance along with an authorised fuel. As well as authorised fuels the list of exempted appliances can be found on the government's website www.uksmokecontrolareas.co.uk The Local Authority may require confirmation that exempt appliance and authorised fuel are to be used.

The applicant is also informed that since January 2022, all new wood burning stove have to meet new EcoDesign Standards.  Further details can be accessed from https://www.london.gov.uk/programmes-and-strategies/environment-and-climate-change/pollution-and-air-quality/guidance-wood-burning-london
